channel.title: The fate of RS?
channel.description:
Is Runescape turning out to resemble a RSPS with the donator store and what not?
/debate lol

item.title: The fate of RS?
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Why the fuck is this a debate? If RS is still online then so be it, if they go offline then so be it? Is a discussion really needed to discuss a game that these forums are based off? Plus this should be in RS Discussion. This thread is pointless.

Read full topic

item.title: The fate of RS?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:24, topic:468065”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=585020.msg4162398#msg4162398 date=1353266813]

It hasn’t been Runescape since the 474 era. They started to focus on graphics instead of gameplay and well… Everything went downhill from there.
[/quote]I believe it was still RuneScape when HD graphics came out. I also think how botting evolved had a big impact on why RuneScape is the way it is today.

Yeah, multi-client support on bots started burning Jagex’s ass, hence why they had the whole “Bot Nuke”.
In my opinion, they would be doing much much better today if they made things much more “interactive” so-to-speak. I.E: More than just click on the tree to cut it, more than just killing monsters to complete a slayer task, etc.

I agree. They also should have deeper penalties on bots. Instead of banning somebody, they should do a complete wipe of the account. Put it back to the start. Would discourage people from botting on their mains.

The only problem with that is the tanking of their revenue. It would probably be just a bit more than half of what it is now. Bots tend to buy membership.

Yet they had no apparent problem when bots were much more scarce. Sure, they punished them, but they had plenty of money[/quote]
I know. I’m sure their budget has become a bit reliant on them now though.

Read full topic

The only problem with that is the tanking of their revenue. It would probably be just a bit more than half of what it is now. Bots tend to buy membership.[/quote]

item.title: The fate of RS?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:21, topic:468065”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=585020.msg4162007#msg4162007 date=1353214387]

It hasn’t been Runescape since the 474 era. They started to focus on graphics instead of gameplay and well… Everything went downhill from there.
[/quote]I believe it was still RuneScape when HD graphics came out. I also think how botting evolved had a big impact on why RuneScape is the way it is today.

Yeah, multi-client support on bots started burning Jagex’s ass, hence why they had the whole “Bot Nuke”.
In my opinion, they would be doing much much better today if they made things much more “interactive” so-to-speak. I.E: More than just click on the tree to cut it, more than just killing monsters to complete a slayer task, etc.

I agree. They also should have deeper penalties on bots. Instead of banning somebody, they should do a complete wipe of the account. Put it back to the start. Would discourage people from botting on their mains.[/quote]
Yeah, pretty much. I personally botted some, but I only ever did it on one small side account, training dungeoneering and fishing, cooking, etc, I never really had 10 clients going and I rarely sold anything, most of my money was made by merching logs.

Read full topic

In my opinion, they would be doing much much better today if they made things much more “interactive” so-to-speak. I.E: More than just click on the tree to cut it, more than just killing monsters to complete a slayer task, etc.[/quote]

item.title: The fate of RS?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Considering how much Runescape has changed since 2005, who knows where the fuck it’ll go. Technology changes constantly, something new is being invented/worked on right now in the technology world, and always is. As the world gets better technology, game companies like Runescape will slowly adapt, we really cannot know, or even guess where it’s going. Especially with Runescape, as some of their updates and changes are completely unexpected.

/thread

Read full topic
